sections.heading: 01|Liability for unauthorized use of credit card
sections.text: Effective:November 18, 1969Latest Legislation:Senate Bill 346 - 108th General AssemblyPDF:Download Authenticated PDFA cardholder who receives a credit card from an issuer, which such cardholder has not requested nor used, shall not be liable for any u

sections.heading: the Revised Code does not  prohibit a loan that is secured by a mortgage on real property  located in this state from being fully recourse to the borrower or  guarantor, including, but not limited to, as a result of a  postclosing solvency covenant, if the loan documents for that loan  do not contai
sections.text: the Revised Code does not prohibit a loan that is secured by a mortgage on real property located in this state from being fully recourse to the borrower or guarantor, including, but not limited to, as a result of a postclosing solvency covenant, if the loan documents for that loan do not contain nonrecourse loan provisions.
